intro: Octomeria grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments.
